intro: Dirichletia princei, commonly known as the Cape York hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of northern Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and red. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a rough, hairy texture, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Dirichletia princei is often found in coastal and lowland areas, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
